html:
6.2.21  11:29 pm   why does the song "it's gonna be alright" make me want to cry even harder?

     it sounds positive..... a bit too positive. so positive, it makes me want to cry.
6.2.21  10:51 pm   are you cool
6.2.21  10:37 pm   heyo. i thought up some great lyrics and a solid melody in the shower. soo how do i find the right chords to back it up??
6.2.21  10:26 pm   What is your favourite chords?
6.2.21  10:03 pm   Do you have any spiritual practice bill?
6.2.21  9:45 pm   is the name of your next song "got to know what's going on?"

     What does it mean?
6.2.21  9:24 am   will your next song mention the sky
6.2.21  9:08 am   What is the first letter of the 7th word in the next song?
6.2.21  4:37 am   which part would you say is the 'chorus' of I'm a princess?

6.2.21  12:57 am   whenever i write melodies for songs, i always use the same chord progression, and its been getting hella repetitive lately. do you have any tips for good chord progressions that compliment a certain melody (the key signature is c minor, if that helps)

6.1.21  8:42 pm   what do you think of angel numbers? when you see certain numbers like on digital clock, the idea is that they have meanings. there are websites that have written interpretations for all the numbers. i've been taken astray in these, and i'm afraid if they're bullshit that i'll end up doing the wrong things. like right now it's 8:38. surely that has some significance. oh yes it means i'm currently on the right path in life. so it this the angels saying that i'm right to listen to them, or is it just generalized bullshit that's made to seem 'potentially legit to some degree'? i've been trying to answer this question by looking them up for a while now and i'm still not 100% sure either way. at the very least it's well written bullshit
6.1.21  8:13 pm   Is the first word in the title of your song "made"?
6.1.21  6:00 pm   why is there so much bad news
6.1.21  5:18 pm   How to use spoon?
6.1.21  5:17 pm   Where do you find the inspiration for your music?

6.1.21  2:33 pm   You said that you don't "feel pressured to make music based on what your fans expect from you", but at the end of "here comes the sun", you say "if this song ain't good enough i'll erase it", which means you do.

6.1.21  12:01 pm   isn't it complete bullshit when a written school assignment has a length requirement?

     like can't i answer the question, but without having to come up with more words to make it long?
6.1.21  9:13 am   Do different notes which are played on a piano give different feelings?
6.1.21  8:08 am   on your songs page, it says "im a princess" was before "here comes the sun," but "im a princess" was released after "here comes the sun." why is that?
6.1.21  6:33 am   should i try to write down everything i know

6.1.21  4:18 am   will your next song be about all the questions people have asked you about what your next song will be about?







PREVIOUS QUESTIONS

5.31.21  5:12 pm   how do you do it to not let others expectations of you alter the work you do?

5.31.21  2:30 pm   what is going on exactly with the time signatures in slow down?
5.31.21  11:53 am   does 'land of the 2 letter words' really exist in real life? or is it just an imaginary land?

      if so, how many times?

5.31.21  6:29 am   what does our ueqstions look like on your screen? like your perspective when you answer and see them

this

     do you have special feelings for different days of the week?

5.30.21  9:11 pm   Looking at your songs list, it seems to me that you're free to do whatever you want to is the absolute milestone in your work. It marks the end of your early amateur efforts and blasts into utter professionalism. It sounds like any of your 2018 songs. How did this giant leap forward happen?
